title: NYC AlgoMatcher
description: NYC AlgoMatcher is a website that helps New Yorkers understand which city algorithms might use their personal data to inform local decision-making, legislation, and budgeting. Read Local Law 35 to learn more.

title: NYC Iconic Run Clubs
description: Inspired by Dan DeWitz's map of NY Time's 57 Sandwiches That Define New York City, I created a healthier homage: a map of run clubs in NYC.

title: Transit Deserts in NYC
description: This map identifies dead transit zones by visualizing NYC subway system's network architecture composed of nodes, flows, and agents.

title: MakAR Tool
description: MakAR is an Augmented Reality application for Meta Orion Smart Glasses, designed for use in the MakerLAB at Cornell Tech. It provides on-demand guidance for students and novice designers who've completed orientation but need support with advanced tools like laser cutters and 3D printers.

title: Predictive Maintenance of NYC Subways
description: I built a predictive maintenance framework using linear and tree-based models to predict passenger delays and subway disruptions. Using K-Means clustering helped identify most vulnerable subway lines to overall transit network. I presented my findings at 2025 NYC Open Data Week.

title: IntelliBART Database
description: IntelliBART is a relational database management system that integrates BART ridership data with GTFS feeds, enabling seamless geospatial and temporal analysis of transit patterns across the Bay Area.

title: Forecasting BART Ridership
description: Inspired by Ben Wellington's I Quant NYC and Abhishek Roy's Commute Chronicles, I took a deep dive into Bay Area transit ridership trends, leveraging advanced ML and time-series forecasting to assess whether ridership would return to pre-pandemic levels.

title: Urban Tech Hub
description: Developed data-driven sustainable tree-planting strategies using QGIS, directly influencing decisions made by New Yorkers for Parks

title: Impact of Selective Migration Policies on Foreign Student Migration and Patenting in the USA
description: Researched history of visa programs (F-1, OPT-STEM, H1-B) to identify suitable intervention periods and control groups; Conducted Difference-in-Difference analysis with three intervention periods to assess impacts over time and authored paper

title: How does disinformation spread?
description: Tasked with designing survey experiment in English and Hindi to investigate belief adaption amid social media misinformation; Crafted neutral questions to capture participants' shifts in belief when reacting to newspaper and social media clippings in survey; Deployed survey experiment among friends/family in India to boost experiment participation and capture diverse perspectives

title: Project Manager at Microfinance at Berkeley
Disaster Tweet Classification using Natural Language Processing
description: I engineered an NLP model to classify tweets as disaster-related or not, achieving 89.2% accuracy on the test set. I built a preprocessing pipeline consisting of stopword removal, lemmatization, and vectorization. Then, I applied feature extraction techniques like Bag of Words and N-Grams to train Logistic Regression and Bernoulli Naive Bayes models.

title: ESRI User Conference 2025
description: Helped run event logistics, while networking and learning about emerging GIS, AI, and LLM tools

title: ESRI Developer & Technology Summit 2025
description: Helped run event logistics, while networking and learning about emerging GIS, AI, and LLM tools

title: Taxonomic Database System of Hawaiian Species
description: Co-digitized Elwood Zimmerman's seven multivolume series on Hawaiian insect taxonomy into a database in Microsoft Access; Organized taxonomical information and species interrelationships into a digitally accessible and searchable format
